pullRequest.title: [FLINK-19292][hive] HiveCatalog should support specifying Hadoop conf dir with configuration
pullRequest.bodyText:
What is the purpose of the change
HiveCatalog currently relies on HADOOP_CONF_DIR env variable to load Hadoop configurations. Users could find it helpful to be able to set the hive conf with the constructor of HiveCatalog. Therefore, HiveCatalog could provide users with the constructor including HiveConf.
Brief change log

HiveCatalog adds the constructor with HiveConf parameter.

Verifying this change

Method testof HiveCatalogFactoryTest adds test case for the HiveCatalog creation with the constructor including HiveConf parameter.

Does this pull request potentially affect one of the following parts:

Dependencies (does it add or upgrade a dependency): (yes / no)
The public API, i.e., is any changed class annotated with @Public(Evolving): (yes / no)
The serializers: (yes / no / don't know)
The runtime per-record code paths (performance sensitive): (yes / no / don't know)
Anything that affects deployment or recovery: JobManager (and its components), Checkpointing, Kubernetes/Yarn/Mesos, ZooKeeper: (yes / no / don't know)
The S3 file system connector: (yes / no / don't know)

Documentation

Does this pull request introduce a new feature? (yes / no)
If yes, how is the feature documented? (not applicable / docs / JavaDocs / not documented)

nodes.bodyText: Let's not modify HadoopUtils. Instead, if hadoopConfDir is not null, set ConfigConstants.PATH_HADOOP_CONFIG in the Configuration instance.
Create a new test case for this
Besides, we need to add a test case for the hadoop conf dir configuration.

beforeCommit.message: [FLINK-19292][hive] HiveCatalog should support specifying Hadoop conf dir with configuration

afterCommit.message: [FLINK-19292][hive] HiveCatalog should support specifying Hadoop conf dir with configuration

nodes.bodyText: We also need yarn-site.xml, which is needed to generate Parquet splits in a kerberized environment.

Let's not rely on HadoopUtils.getHadoopConfiguration to get the configuration. We can just call HadoopUtils.possibleHadoopConfPaths to get the paths and load the files by ourselves. And the loading logic should be consistent with HiveTableUtil.getHadoopConfiguration.
This comment should be migrated to HiveTableUtil::getHadoopConfiguration
